channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hedge Funds: A Poor Choice for Most Long-Term Investors?
item.description: By allocating to a diversified pool of hedge funds, many institutional investors are unwittingly reducing their equity holdings.

item.title: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang plays down competition worries as key supplier disappoints with subdued expectations for AI chip sales
item.description: Hype for AI is so feverish that even meeting expectations isn't enough for investors.

item.title: Did Inflation Kill the CAPM?
item.description: While the immediate future may not be promising for the equity premium, it looks bright for factor premiums.

item.title: China’s AI companies are reportedly rationing the use of their services because they don’t have enough chips
item.description: Blame the U.S. and its export controls blocking AI chip sales to China.

item.title: Behavior of Crowds not Wisdom of Crowds
item.description: When behavioral crowds are roiling the markets, as they are now, best idea active equity has an excellent chance of outperforming.

item.title: Democrats have begun to talk about replacing Biden for the 2024 election. Here’s how that would work—and the hurdles to it happening
item.description: With Biden having already secured a presumptive nomination, Democrats’ prospects for a course change are diminishing.

item.title: Is the Outright Ban on a US Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) a Mistake?
item.description: Instead of outright banning a US CBDC, wouldn’t it be preferrable to establish clear and enforceable legislative guardrails?

item.title: Amid election nerves French traders race to secure funding as they foresee the worst blow to bonds
item.description: “There is nothing to win in this market.”

item.title: Concerned About Market Concentration and Lofty Valuations? Consider Small Caps
item.description: Investors are showing increased concern about large-cap stocks due to high market concentration and lofty stock valuations. Other factors combine to make a compelling case for small caps.

item.title: CEO of cosmetics giant L’Oreal announces slower growth as Chinese market flatlines
item.description: China had long been a growth engine for L’Oreal, with consumers snapping up its high-end cosmetics offerings.
